channel.title: Vps
channel.description: What does a vps do? i know it stands for virtual private server.. but what does it basically do other than reduce lag.

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:2, topic:402749”]runs 24/7, which is why people use them for servers,uh… here…
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_private_server[/quote]
People use them because:

  1. They have a better internet connection than you
  2. They’re running on a cleaner computer than you
  3. They are more reliable than you
  4. They have better performance than you
  5. If managed, they’re online more than you

Do I really have to say more?

Read full topic

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

runs 24/7, which is why people use them for servers,uh… here…

en.wikipedia.org

Virtual private server

A Virtual Private Server (VPS) is a virtual machine sold as a service by an Internet hosting service. A VPS runs its own copy of an operating system (OS), and customers may have superuser-level access to that operating system instance, so they can install almost any software that runs on that OS. For many purposes they are functionally equivalent to a dedicated physical server, and being software-defined, are able to be much more easily created and configured. They are priced much lower than an e...
